content:
From: Makarius <makarius@sketis.net>
* Isabelle/jEdit Prover IDE *

  • Improved GUI look-and-feel: the portable and scalable FlatLightLaf is
    used by default on all platforms (appearance similar to IntelliJ IDEA).

This refers to Isabelle/efc58b56a6c7, it avoids various GUI problems on Linux
(broken GTK), Windows (bad button fonts), macOS (visual glitches).

Existing Isabelle installations (repository closes etc.) need to change
Utilities / Global Options / Appearance / Swing look & feel to "FlatLaf
Light", or "FlatLaf Dark" (presently untested).

Makarius

isabelle-dev mailing list
isabelle-dev@in.tum.de
https://mailman46.in.tum.de/mailman/listinfo/isabelle-dev

From: Makarius <makarius@sketis.net>
In Isabelle/9480a9efe19e I have made a small patch to FlatLightLaf to get the
buttons in the Symbols dockable right (Digits, Letters).

The corresponding issue https://github.com/JFormDesigner/FlatLaf/issues/234
got closed rather quickly. The guy behind the project is actually from the
Munich area: Karl Tauber as founder of https://www.formdev.com/company

If there are further fine points for our great new look-and-feel, I will
refine them for the release.

Bigger renovations may come after the release: there is no need to have old
Java applications look crappy.

Makarius
